page.title: 10ELMBRIDGE - ENERGY
page.content: Through this small rural area pass three of the main sources of energy used in this country today. There is a section of a new underground oil pipe line being placed this year. It is part of 120 mile stretch from Southampton to Wolverhampton and carries all grades of oil. There is also a 24 inch underground gas main and a number of large electricity pylons which supply part of the national grid. Householders use oil, electricity and propane gas for central heating in their homes as there is no natural gas available locally. Many also have open fires and wood burning stoves to heat the house, also used are Aga cookers and Rayburn stoves which provide heat as well as cooking. Most other houses cook with electricity but a few use propane gas.
